title: Tarczyński Group
text:
Tarczyński Group is a <a href="corporate%20group">corporate group</a> of enterprises specialising in the <a href="meat%20industry">meat industry</a>. Since June 2013, the <a href="joint-stock%20company">joint-stock company</a> is registered on the <a href="Warsaw%20Stock%20Exchange">Warsaw Stock Exchange</a>. The headquarters of the dominating corporate unit is located in <a href="Uje%C5%BAdziec%20Ma%C5%82y">Ujeździec Mały</a>, Poland.
The Tarczyński Group handles the production, packaging and distribution of meat produce, specialising in pork and poultry, leading the Polish market in the sale of <a href="kabanos">kabanos</a> and <a href="Curing%20%28food%20preservation%29">cured meat</a>. The firm holds three production plants in <a href="Uje%C5%BAdziec%20Ma%C5%82y">Ujeździec Mały</a>, <a href="Bielsko-Bia%C5%82a">Bielsko-Biała</a> and <a href="S%C5%82awa">Sława</a>. 
History.
The Zakład Przetwórstwa Mięsnego Jacek Tarczyński was founded in 1989 in <a href="Su%C5%82%C3%B3w%2C%20Lower%20Silesian%20Voivodeship">Sułów</a>, southwest of <a href="Milicz">Milicz</a>. In 1996, the firm acquired the ownership rights over the agrarian <a href="cooperative">cooperative</a> Spółdzielnia Rolniczo-Handlowa "Samopomoc Polska" located in <a href="Trzebnica">Trzebnica</a>. Two years later, in 1998, the firm restructured itself as the <a href="private%20limited%20company">private limited company</a> Zakład Przetwórstwa Mięsnego "Tarczyński" <a href="Sp%C3%B3%C5%82ka%20z%20ograniczon%C4%85%20odpowiedzialno%C5%9Bci%C4%85">Sp. z o.o.</a> 
In 2004 the ZPM "Tarczyński" transformed into a <a href="joint-stock%20company">joint-stock company</a>, with its rebranding completed by 2005. In 2005, the company Dobrosława (founded in 1945) was acquired and transformed a partnership of the joint-stock company. In 2007, Tarczyński Group acquired 100% of the shares of Starpeck Sp. z o.o., with its headquarters located in <a href="Bielsko-Bia%C5%82a">Bielsko-Biała</a>. The Tarczyński Group began trading on the <a href="Warsaw%20Stock%20Exchange">Warsaw Stock Exchange</a> as of June 18, 2013.
Structure.
The Tarczyński Group has its headquarters located in <a href="Uje%C5%BAdziec%20Ma%C5%82y">Ujeździec Mały</a>, near <a href="Milicz">Milicz</a> in Poland. The joint-stock company holds three production plants in:
Apart from the national market in <a href="Poland">Poland</a>, the Tarczyński Group exports its meat products to thirteen other European countries: <a href="Estonia">Estonia</a>, <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>, <a href="Lithuania">Lithuania</a>, Germany, the <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>, France, the United Kingdom, Ireland, Italy, <a href="Greece">Greece</a>, Sweden, <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a> as well as <a href="Romania">Romania</a>. 
Tarczyński Group introduced the following regulations to its structure quality of produce: <a href="British%20Retail%20Consortium">British Retail Consortium</a> and the International Food Standard.
